basics.name: Matías G. Villalba
basics.label: Economist
basics.summary: Recent graduate with a Bachelor's degree in Economics from Universidad del Pacífico (Perú), where I was adviced on my thesis by Alberto Chong and researched the impact of COVID-19 policies on the efficiency of public procurement. Currently woking as an RA to Manuel Barron at CIUP. With a passion for academia and research, particularly in topics of development economics, machine learning, and political economy.

work.name: Centro de Investigación de la Universidad del Pacífico (CIUP)
work.summary: Assisted with the development of a randomized control trial studying the effect of homophily on academicoutcomes within student social networks.
highlights: Designed and conducted baseline and endline surveys, critical for the project's data collection.
Utilized Stata for rigorous cleaning and analysis of survey and large administrative datasets (+250k observations).
Created comprehensive tables in LaTeX, along with insightful figures.

work.name: George Mason University and Inter-American Development Bank
work.summary: Assisted with multiple concurrent projects in political economy, primarily focusing on impact evaluation studiesanalyzing the effects of extreme COVID-19 policies in Colombia and Chile.
highlights: Utilized Stata and Python for web-scraping and complex data cleaning of massive government datasets (+2M observations).
Used OCR tools in Python for large-scale text extraction.
Fine-tuned and applied LLM for systematic entity identification and extraction, crucial to the project's methodology

education.studyType: MicroMaster Program in Data, Economics, and Design of Policy
